fullDescription.text:
Lodash is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to the potential to modify the properties of objects in memory. A remote attacker could run arbitrary commands on a vulnerable server, or cause the server to crash, by maliciously crafting an object via the zip functionality of Lodash.

Note: this issue was not properly addressed and required an additional fix and disclosure (**BDSA-2020-3839**).

fullDescription.text:
Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This is due to multiple methods not validating the length of content supplied to it.  If an application is passing untrusted-input to the Lodash library, it may be possible for an attacker to cause the process to crash, resulting in a DoS condition.

Please note that this issue is not considered by the vendor to be a vulnerability in Lodash, however it could be exploited if an application using Lodash accepts user input without validation and passes it to the affected functions. A pull request was opened to update the Lodash documentation regarding this issue but it was closed and not merged.

fullDescription.text:
Lodash is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) as the user-controllable input to certain functions is not sufficiently checked, allowing an attacker to add or modify existing properties of presumably immutable `Object` data structure. An unauthenticated attacker can leverage this flaw to add arbitrary properties to objects used by the web application which can be leveraged to cause a crash or to prevent the server from responding to all requests.

This vulnerability may also lead to remote code execution (RCE) in some applications, depending on the implementation.

fullDescription.text:
Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This is due to multiple methods not validating the length of content supplied to it.  If an application is passing untrusted-input to the Lodash library, it may be possible for an attacker to cause the process to crash, resulting in a DoS condition.

Please note that this issue is not considered by the vendor to be a vulnerability in Lodash, however it could be exploited if an application using Lodash accepts user input without validation and passes it to the affected functions. A pull request was opened to update the Lodash documentation regarding this issue but it was closed and not merged.

fullDescription.text:
Lodash is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) as the user-controllable input to certain functions is not sufficiently checked, allowing an attacker to add or modify existing properties of presumably immutable `Object` data structure. An unauthenticated attacker can leverage this flaw to add arbitrary properties to objects used by the web application which can be leveraged to cause a crash or to prevent the server from responding to all requests.

This vulnerability may also lead to remote code execution (RCE) in some applications, depending on the implementation.

fullDescription.text: st is a module for serving static files. An attacker is able to craft a request that results in an HTTP 301 (redirect) to an entirely different domain. A request for: http://some.server.com//nodesecurity.org/%2e%2e would result in a 301 to //nodesecurity.org/%2e%2e which most browsers treat as a proper redirect as // is translated into the current schema being used. Mitigating factor: In order for this to work, st must be serving from the root of a server (/) rather than the typical sub directory (/static/) and the redirect URL will end with some form of URL encoded .. ("%2e%2e", "%2e.", ".%2e").

fullDescription.text: A vulnerability was found in LinkedIn dustjs up to 2.x and classified as problematic. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality. The manipulation leads to improperly controlled modification of object prototype attributes ('prototype pollution'). The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. Upgrading to version 3.0.0 is able to address this issue. The name of the patch is ddb6523832465d38c9d80189e9de60519ac307c3. It is recommended to upgrade the affected component. The identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-216464.

fullDescription.text: It was discovered that jQuery could allow for cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities to be introduced if certain HTML is passed to Document Object Model (DOM) manipulation methods. Attackers could exploit XSS vulnerabilities to execute JavaScript code in a target browser by tricking them into accessing the vulnerable page. This would allow an attacker to steal an administrator's session tokens or execute arbitrary code on their behalf by sending the link to an unsuspecting user or waiting for them to discover it.

# CVE-2020-11023 jQuery 2.2.4
## Upgrade Guidance

**Short Term** - 

**Long Term** - 3.7.1

## Description
It was discovered that jQuery could allow for cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities to be introduced if certain HTML is passed to Document Object Model (DOM) manipulation methods. Attackers could exploit XSS vulnerabilities to execute JavaScript code in a target browser by tricking them into accessing the vulnerable page. This would allow an attacker to steal an administrator's session tokens or execute arbitrary code on their behalf by sending the link to an unsuspecting user or waiting for them to discover it.

fullDescription.text:
jQuery is vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) due to a flaw present in Document Object Model (DOM) manipulation methods.

An attacker could craft HTML content that when viewed by a victim user could allow for the execution of arbitrary scripts. Such scripts could be used to steal tokens or tamper with the rendering of the web content.

**Note**: This reported issue appears to be a duplicate of **CVE-2020-11023** (**BDSA-2020-0964**).

fullDescription.text:
ejs is vulnerable to server-side template injection (SSTI) leading to remote code execution (RCE) when an application using ejs has user controlled input passed directly into the `res.render()` function. This could allow a remote attacker to execute commands on the underlying web server of such an application.

**Note**: The validity of this vulnerability is contested by the maintainer of this application in [this](https://github.com/mde/ejs/issues/720#issuecomment-1540435858) comment, since they already have a specific guidance against passing user input to `res.render()` [here](https://github.com/mde/ejs/blob/main/SECURITY.md#out-of-scope-vulnerabilities).

fullDescription.text:
Minimist contains a prototype pollution vulnerability. A remote attacker could exploit this issue by adding or modifying properties of `Function.prototype`, which may lead to execution of arbitrary code.

**Note:** This vulnerability occurs from an incomplete fix of **CVE-2020-7598**, where the `Object`, `String` and `Number` prototypes are fixed, but not `Function`.

The exact impact that the attacker can achieve will depend on how the object is used. Possible impacts include remote code execution (RCE) and denial-of-service (DoS).

fullDescription.text:
The `ms` package is a milliseconds conversion utility. The regular expression used by the function to parse the time is vulnerable to a denial-of-service condition due to CPU consumption that can cause an application running the ms package to hang by blocking the event loop. 

An attacker can achieve this by forcing ms to parse an extremely long version String, This is a Regular Expression Denial-of-Service (ReDoS).

fullDescription.text:
set-value is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to insufficient input validation.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to modify the Object prototype properties which causes additional properties or changes to the objects which could result in denial-of-service (DoS) or alter the integrity of the application. If the application uses polluted objects in conjunction with code execution primitives (such as eval), it may be possible for an attacker to execute malicious code.

It was later determined that this issue could be bypassed via a type confusion vulnerability as noted in **CVE-2021-23440** (**BDSA-2021-2911**).

fullDescription.text:
TypeORM is vulnerable to SQL injection (SQLi) due to improper validation of user-supplied input. This could allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute malicious SQL statements to alter or retrieve information stored on the application's databases.

**Note:** A further report [here](https://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2022/Aug/7) has indicated that the fix for this vulnerability introduces a further information disclosure issue. It should be noted that the maintainer does not consider either report as valid vulnerabilities and stated the root cause is bad input validation. The CVE is currently being disputed.

message.text: Lodash is vulnerable to command injection via the `template` function. An attacker can take advantage of this vulnerability in order to run arbitrary commands.

lodash is vulnerable to a prototype pollution flaw. A remote attacker may be able to supply specially crafted input to cause serious confidentiality, integrity and availability impacts to the application. In the past, such vulnerabilities have lead to remote code execution (RCE) in the end application.

Lodash is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to the potential to modify the properties of objects in memory. A remote attacker could run arbitrary commands on a vulnerable server, or cause the server to crash, by maliciously crafting an object via the zip functionality of Lodash.

Note: this issue was not properly addressed and required an additional fix and disclosure (**BDSA-2020-3839**).

Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This is due to multiple methods not validating the length of content supplied to it.  If an application is passing untrusted-input to the Lodash library, it may be possible for an attacker to cause the process to crash, resulting in a DoS condition.

Please note that this issue is not considered by the vendor to be a vulnerability in Lodash, however it could be exploited if an application using Lodash accepts user input without validation and passes it to the affected functions. A pull request was opened to update the Lodash documentation regarding this issue but it was closed and not merged.
Lodash contains a prototype pollution flaw. An attacker could exploit this to modify the component or cause remote code execution or a denial-of-service (*DoS*).

Lodash is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) as the user-controllable input to certain functions is not sufficiently checked, allowing an attacker to add or modify existing properties of presumably immutable `Object` data structure. An unauthenticated attacker can leverage this flaw to add arbitrary properties to objects used by the web application which can be leveraged to cause a crash or to prevent the server from responding to all requests.

This vulnerability may also lead to remote code execution (RCE) in some applications, depending on the implementation.

Lodash contains an uncontrolled resource consumption flaw. This could be exploited by a remote attacker by supplying a specially crafted regular expression to trigger a denial-of-service (DoS) due to application hanging.
Lodash contains a prototype pollution flaw. An attacker could exploit this to modify the component or create a denial-of-service (DoS).

Lodash is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to functionality that allows users to influence protoypes. An attacker could cause a vulnerable application to crash by providing malicious input that modifies JavaScript prototypes within the application. It may also be possible for an attacker to modify data that exists within the application.
Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this using crafted regular expressions to exhaust system resources.

The `package.json` file generated by node package manager for the lodash library contains out-dated information. The `contributors` section of the package.json file contains an URL that has been flagged for serving malware.

Lodash is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to the potential to modify the properties of objects in memory. A remote attacker could run arbitrary commands on a vulnerable server, or cause the server to crash, by maliciously crafting an object via the zip functionality of Lodash.

Note: this issue was not properly addressed and required an additional fix and disclosure (**BDSA-2020-3839**).

Lodash is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) as the user-controllable input to certain functions is not sufficiently checked, allowing an attacker to add or modify existing properties of presumably immutable `Object` data structure. An unauthenticated attacker can leverage this flaw to add arbitrary properties to objects used by the web application which can be leveraged to cause a crash or to prevent the server from responding to all requests.

This vulnerability may also lead to remote code execution (RCE) in some applications, depending on the implementation.
Lodash contains a prototype pollution flaw. An attacker could exploit this to modify the component or cause remote code execution or a denial-of-service (*DoS*).

Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This is due to multiple methods not validating the length of content supplied to it.  If an application is passing untrusted-input to the Lodash library, it may be possible for an attacker to cause the process to crash, resulting in a DoS condition.

Please note that this issue is not considered by the vendor to be a vulnerability in Lodash, however it could be exploited if an application using Lodash accepts user input without validation and passes it to the affected functions. A pull request was opened to update the Lodash documentation regarding this issue but it was closed and not merged.

lodash is vulnerable to a prototype pollution flaw. A remote attacker may be able to supply specially crafted input to cause serious confidentiality, integrity and availability impacts to the application. In the past, such vulnerabilities have lead to remote code execution (RCE) in the end application.
Lodash is vulnerable to command injection via the `template` function. An attacker can take advantage of this vulnerability in order to run arbitrary commands.
Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this using crafted regular expressions to exhaust system resources.

An attacker could cause a vulnerable application to crash by providing malicious input that modifies JavaScript prototypes within the application. It may also be possible for an attacker to modify data that exists within the application.

The `package.json` file generated by node package manager for the lodash library contains out-dated information. The `contributors` section of the package.json file contains an URL that has been flagged for serving malware.

Mongoose is vulnerable to a prototype pollution issue due to a lack of sufficient input validation when setting the schema object. An attacker could inject a malicious payload containing a modified `Object.prototype` entry in order to potentially cause Mongoose to execute untrusted code or crash outright.

Mongoose is vulnerable to a prototype pollution issue due to a lack of sufficient input validation in the `Schema.prototype.path()` function when setting the schema object.

An attacker could inject a malicious payload containing a modified `Object.prototype` entry in order to potentially cause Mongoose to execute untrusted code or crash outright.
mongoose is vulnerable to excessive memory allocation leading to disclosure of sensitive information within memory and denial-of-service (DoS).
Mongoose contains an authentication bypass vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this to bypass authentication mechanisms and potentially steal sensitive information.

st is vulnerable to an open redirection attack because it does not validate input that redirects users to an external site. An attacker can craft a request that redirects a user to a maliciously crafted domain. The attacker can potentially carry out a phishing attack or other actions that compromise the system's security.

st is a module for serving static files. An attacker is able to craft a request that results in an HTTP 301 (redirect) to an entirely different domain. A request for: http://some.server.com//nodesecurity.org/%2e%2e would result in a 301 to //nodesecurity.org/%2e%2e which most browsers treat as a proper redirect as // is translated into the current schema being used. Mitigating factor: In order for this to work, st must be serving from the root of a server (/) rather than the typical sub directory (/static/) and the redirect URL will end with some form of URL encoded .. ("%2e%2e", "%2e.", ".%2e").

Node.js cthackers adm-zip package is vulnerable to an arbitrary file write vulnerability via a directory traversal. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying the component with a maliciously crafted archive that, when unpacked, would cause an arbitrary file to be written to the file system.

ansi-regex is vulnerable to a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) issue due to how certain crafted ANSI escaped codes are mishandled.

An attacker could submit a crafted string that, when matched, could cause excessive consumption of system resources that will impact stability and potentially cause a crash.

Debug-js is vulnerable to a regular expression denial-of-service when malicious regular expression input is passed into the `%o` formatter. A remote attacker can exploit this flaw by supplying crafted input to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

**Note**: **CVE-2017-20165** (**BDSA-2017-4102**) is a duplicate disclosure of this issue.

Debug-js is vulnerable to a regular expression denial-of-service when malicious regular expression input is passed into the `%o` formatter. A remote attacker can exploit this flaw by supplying crafted input to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

**Note**: This issue is a duplicate disclosure of **CVE-2017-16137** (**BDSA-2017-3626**).

decode-uri-component contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. Successful exploitation of this issue enables an unauthenticated attacker to cause an application crash within the decoding process, by supplying a crafted input file.

A vulnerability was found in LinkedIn dustjs up to 2.x and classified as problematic. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality. The manipulation leads to improperly controlled modification of object prototype attributes ('prototype pollution'). The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. Upgrading to version 3.0.0 is able to address this issue. The name of the patch is ddb6523832465d38c9d80189e9de60519ac307c3. It is recommended to upgrade the affected component. The identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-216464.
This affects the package express-fileupload before 1.1.8. If the parseNested option is enabled, sending a corrupt HTTP request can lead to denial of service or arbitrary code execution.

The hoek module for Node is vulnerable to prototype pollution. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to modify the `Object` prototype which causes additional properties or changes to exist on all objects.

hosted-git-info is vulnerable to regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) via `fromUrl()`. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a maliciously crafted input to consume resources, thus resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS) condition occurring.

It was discovered that jQuery could allow for cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities to be introduced if certain HTML is passed to Document Object Model (DOM) manipulation methods. Attackers could exploit XSS vulnerabilities to execute JavaScript code in a target browser by tricking them into accessing the vulnerable page. This would allow an attacker to steal an administrator's session tokens or execute arbitrary code on their behalf by sending the link to an unsuspecting user or waiting for them to discover it.

jQuery is vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) due to a flaw present in Document Object Model (DOM) manipulation methods.

An attacker could craft HTML content that when viewed by a victim user could allow for the execution of arbitrary scripts. Such scripts could be used to steal tokens or tamper with the rendering of the web content.

**Note**: This reported issue appears to be a duplicate of **CVE-2020-11023** (**BDSA-2020-0964**).

It was discovered that jQuery could allow for cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities to be introduced if `jQuery.htmlPrefilter` method is used. Attackers could exploit XSS vulnerabilities to execute JavaScript code in a target's browser by tricking them into accessing the vulnerable page. This would allow an attacker to steal an administrator's session tokens or execute arbitrary code on their behalf by sending the link to an unsuspecting user or waiting for them to discover it.

An improper input validation vulnerability has been discovered in JQuery. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, trigger a denial-of-service (DoS) condition, or gain unauthorized access to the application.
jQuery is vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) due to the way it processes certain types of Ajax requests. This can allow potential attackers to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
jQuery is vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) due to lack of validation of user-supplied input. This could allow an attacker to inject arbitrary web scripts and steal a victim's session cookies.

jQuery contains commented references to the hijacked domain `blindsignals`, within the files `src/queue/delay.js` and `test/data/jquery-1.9.1.js` (the former referring to a Web Archive version of the original site). Users without awareness of the domain's status could be exposed to unspecified attacks if they attempt to follow the links to the hijacked site.

Bson contains a deserialization of untrusted data vulnerability due to improper handling of user input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability through specially crafted input which could lead to the application treating the input in a way it was not intended, such as data disclosure.

The js-bson module for MongoDB contains a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) flaw. An attacker could exploit this by passing a long untrusted string to the component. If successful, the component will crash.
js-bson contains an information disclosure vulnerability. This allows an attacker that is able to supply crafted data to applications using js-bson to potentially disclose information.
Fresh contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this using crafted regular expressions to exhaust system resources.

The kind-of module contains a validation bypass vulnerability.  This allows attacker to potentially bypass validation checks being performed on user-supplied input by applications using the kind-of module.

marked contains a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability. This allows an attacker to execute malicious JavaScript code in a victim's instance of marked, which could be used to steal session tokens, cookies, or other sensitive information.
Marked is vulnerable to cross-site scripting (*XSS*) due to improper validation of user-supplied input. This vulnerability can be used to execute JavaScript-based attacks.

Marked is vulnerable to regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) due to a flaw present within a regular expression in the `src/rules.js` file. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a maliciously crafted input in order to consume resources, thus resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS) condition occurring.

Marked is vulnerable to regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) due to a flaw present within a regular expression in the `src/rules.js` file. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a maliciously crafted input in order to consume resources, thus resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS) condition occurring.

The Node.js marked module contains a flaw when handling regular expressions. The component uses a vulnerable regular expression when parsing markdown content which is vulnerable to exponential blowup. This could be exploited by an attacker to cause a slowdown and denial-of-service (*DoS*) condition. Requests will be delayed, but eventually processed.

ejs is vulnerable to server-side template injection (SSTI) leading to remote code execution (RCE) when an application using ejs has user controlled input passed directly into the `res.render()` function. This could allow a remote attacker to execute commands on the underlying web server of such an application.

**Note**: The validity of this vulnerability is contested by the maintainer of this application in [this](https://github.com/mde/ejs/issues/720#issuecomment-1540435858) comment, since they already have a specific guidance against passing user input to `res.render()` [here](https://github.com/mde/ejs/blob/main/SECURITY.md#out-of-scope-vulnerabilities).
Weak input validation in the `ejs.renderFile()` function in the ejs package for Node.js could allow an attacker to perform remote code execution.
nodejs ejs version older than 2.5.5 is vulnerable to a denial-of-service due to weak input validation in the ejs.renderFile()
nodejs ejs version older than 2.5.5 is vulnerable to a Cross-site-scripting in the ejs.renderFile() resulting in code injection

Mime is vulnerable to regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) due to a poorly implemented regular expression.  A remote attacker could impact the performance of a vulnerable application, or perhaps cause it to crash, by causing it to process a maliciously crafted path.

The module minimatch is vulnerable to a regular expression denial-of-service (*ReDoS*) via incorrect regular expression validation in the function `minimatch(path, pattern)`.

Minimatch package contains a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) vulnerability because of improper input validation. An attacker could exploit this flaw by calling the `braceExpand()` function with specific arguments.

Minimatch package contains a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) vulnerability because of improper input validation. An attacker could exploit this flaw by calling the `braceExpand()` function with specific arguments.

minimist is vulnerable to a prototype pollution attack. A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) by tricking the library into modifying or adding properties of `Object.prototype` via a `constructor` or `__proto__` payload.

**Note**: This issue was not properly fixed and required an additional disclosure as **CVE-2021-44906** (BDSA-2022-0771).

Minimist contains a prototype pollution vulnerability. A remote attacker could exploit this issue by adding or modifying properties of `Function.prototype`, which may lead to execution of arbitrary code.

**Note:** This vulnerability occurs from an incomplete fix of **CVE-2020-7598**, where the `Object`, `String` and `Number` prototypes are fixed, but not `Function`.

Mixin-deep is vulnerable to prototype pollution attack. This could allow an attacker to manipulate a function to add or modify properties of `Object.prototype` via a constructor payload. Successfully exploiting results in a denial-of-service (DoS) and code execution may be possible.

moment contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this using crafted regular expressions to exhaust system resources and cause a system crash.

**Note:** This vulnerability affects any instance of moment that has separate format and standalone options, and where the `format` input is controlled by the user.

Moment is vulnerable to regular expression denial-of-service (`ReDoS`) when parsing dates as strings. Potential attackers could leverage this flaw to slow down the application to the point where it becomes unusable.

moment is vulnerable to path traversal which may lead to the modification of sensitive information within a file directory on the file system. An attacker can exploit this flaw by manipulating directory pathways using unwanted characters to access and modify a resource that is outside the intended directory.
A prototype pollution vulnerability was found in module mpath <0.5.1 that allows an attacker to inject arbitrary properties onto Object.prototype.

mpath is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to the existence of a type confusion flaw. A remote attacker could modify the properties of an object by sending maliciously crafted requests to a vulnerable application. The exact impact that the attacker can achieve will depend on how the object is used. Possible impacts include remote code execution (RCE) and denial-of-service (DoS).

Vercel ms contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this using crafted regular expressions to exhaust system resources and cause a system crash.

**Note:** This vulnerability exists due to an incomplete fix for **CVE-2015-8315**.

The `ms` package is a milliseconds conversion utility. The regular expression used by the function to parse the time is vulnerable to a denial-of-service condition due to CPU consumption that can cause an application running the ms package to hang by blocking the event loop. 

An attacker can achieve this by forcing ms to parse an extremely long version String, This is a Regular Expression Denial-of-Service (ReDoS).

Vercel ms contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this using crafted regular expressions to exhaust system resources and cause a system crash.

The MongoDB driver for Node.js is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper exception handling. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying an application with maliciously crafted data.

Node Semver is vulnerable due to improper handling of whitespaces. A remote unauthenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by providing a crafted input in order to cause a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS).

Node Semver is vulnerable due to improper handling of whitespaces. A remote unauthenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by providing a crafted input in order to cause a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS).

The Semver package for Node.js contains a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) vulnerability.  An attacker can use this vulnerability to cause applications to hang for a long time or result in a denial-of-service due to cpu consumption.

Node Semver is vulnerable due to improper handling of whitespaces. A remote unauthenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by providing a crafted input in order to cause a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS).

xml2js version 0.4.23 allows an external attacker to edit or add new properties to an object. This is possible because the application does not properly validate incoming JSON keys, thus allowing the __proto__ property to be edited.

The ini package is vulnerable to prototype pollution attacks.  A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition. The impact of this vulnerability is reliant on the ini package parsing a untrusted input.

path-parse contains a vulnerability to regular expression denial of service (ReDoS). An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a maliciously crafted input to consume the application's resources, thus resulting in a denial-of-service condition occurring.

qs is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the excessive time required to process `proto` properties of the output JavaScript objects. An unauthenticated attacker could send a request with a manipulated `proto` properties and cause the Node server to freeze as it tries to process the input.
qs is vulnerable to denial-of-service (*DoS*) due to improper validation of user-supplied input. This could allow an attacker to render services unavailable or potentially craft other attacks.

qs is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the excessive time required to process `proto` properties of the output JavaScript objects. An unauthenticated attacker could send a request with a manipulated `proto` properties and cause the Node server to freeze as it tries to process the input.
qs is vulnerable to denial-of-service (*DoS*) due to improper validation of user-supplied input. This could allow an attacker to render services unavailable or potentially craft other attacks.

set-value is vulnerable to a prototype pollution attack due to a type confusion error which can lead to a bypass of **CVE-2019-10747** (**BDSA-2019-4362**). A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) by tricking the library into modifying or adding properties of `Object.prototype`.

set-value is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to insufficient input validation.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to modify the Object prototype properties which causes additional properties or changes to the objects which could result in denial-of-service (DoS) or alter the integrity of the application. If the application uses polluted objects in conjunction with code execution primitives (such as eval), it may be possible for an attacker to execute malicious code.

It was later determined that this issue could be bypassed via a type confusion vulnerability as noted in **CVE-2021-23440** (**BDSA-2021-2911**).

set-value is vulnerable to a prototype pollution attack due to a type confusion error which can lead to a bypass of **CVE-2019-10747** (**BDSA-2019-4362**). A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) by tricking the library into modifying or adding properties of `Object.prototype`.

set-value is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to insufficient input validation.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to modify the Object prototype properties which causes additional properties or changes to the objects which could result in denial-of-service (DoS) or alter the integrity of the application. If the application uses polluted objects in conjunction with code execution primitives (such as eval), it may be possible for an attacker to execute malicious code.

It was later determined that this issue could be bypassed via a type confusion vulnerability as noted in **CVE-2021-23440** (**BDSA-2021-2911**).

tough-cookie is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to improper handling of cookies when using `CookieJar` in `rejectPublicSuffixes=false` mode.  An attacker can use this vulnerability to override the global object prototype in order to cause unspecified impacts.

TypeORM is vulnerable to SQL injection (SQLi) due to improper validation of user-supplied input. This could allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute malicious SQL statements to alter or retrieve information stored on the application's databases.

**Note:** A further report [here](https://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2022/Aug/7) has indicated that the fix for this vulnerability introduces a further information disclosure issue. It should be noted that the maintainer does not consider either report as valid vulnerabilities and stated the root cause is bad input validation. The CVE is currently being disputed.

unset-value is vulnerable to a prototype pollution attack. A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) by tricking the library into modifying or adding properties of `Object.prototype`.

y18n is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to the unsafe construction of objects. An attacker could modify the properties of underlying prototypes by sending maliciously crafted requests to a vulnerable application. This could potentially allow them to crash the application, or alter the application's execution flow.
yargs-parser is vulnerable to privilege escalation and remote code execution (RCE) via prototype pollution.
